turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bathymodiolus tangaroa.
turn.1: What do you know about the tangaroa?
turn.2: Bathymodiolus tangaroa Bathymodiolus tangaroa is a species of deep-sea mussel, a marine bivalve mollusk in the family Mytilidae, the mussels.
turn.4: This species was first described from northern New Zealand, from seeps off Cape Turnagain and Cape Kidnappers at a depth of .
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The shell of this species is large, up to long, showing external dull white growth lines.
turn.8: Its anterior margin is narrow but evenly rounded.
turn.10: Its posterior margin is convex dorsally, its posterior angulation well-defined, situated above the posterior adductor scar.
turn.11: What else do you find interesting?
turn.12: Its periostracum is thick, hard and a dark brown colour.
